item.title: 美国消费者支出自年初以来首次下降
item.description: 美国 5 月份消费者支出的降幅是今年年初以来最大的，这表明特朗普政府经济政策的不确定性正在日益拖累经济增长前景。【原文：US consumer spending declined in May by the most since the start of the year, indicating elevated uncertainty around the Trump administration’s economic policies is increasingly weighing on the outlook for growth.】

item.title: 加拿大第二季度经济将出现萎缩
item.description: 加拿大经济本季度有望出现小幅下滑，但下滑速度并不像一些经济学家担心的那样快。【原文：The Canadian economy is on track for a modest decline this quarter, yet isn’t deteriorating as fast as some economists feared.】

item.title: 摩根大通认为前沿市场将随着风险消退而进一步反弹
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Frontier-market bonds should deliver robust returns over the coming quarter, benefiting from receding geopolitical risks, dollar weakness and elevated gold prices, according to strategists at JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 贝森特称特朗普的贸易努力可能在美国劳动节前结束
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，特朗普政府的贸易协议议程可能会在劳动节假期前结束，这表明一些谈判很可能会延续到即将到来的 7 月互惠关税提高截止日期之后。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the Trump administration’s agenda for trade agreements could get wrapped up by the Labor Day holiday, indicating some negotiations are likely to extend past the upcoming July deadline for elevated reciprocal tariffs.】

item.title: 美国就业增长乏力的警示信号
item.description: 我是驻哥伦布的美国经济记者马克-尼奎特。今天我们关注美国劳动力市场。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册接收本新闻通讯，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Mark Niquette, a US economy reporter in Columbus. Today we’re looking at the US labor market. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利认为今年将有两次降息，关税前景不明
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，他认为今年可能会有两次降息，第一次可能在9月份，但他警告说，关税可能会对通胀产生延迟影响，决策者应保持灵活。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said he sees two interest-rate cuts as likely this year — with the first potentially in September — but warned that tariffs could have a delayed impact on inflation and policymakers should remain flexible.】

item.title: 中国央行称经济发展势头良好但挑战依然存在
item.description: 中国央行表示，中国经济正呈现积极迹象，信心正在建立，但内需不足和通货紧缩压力等挑战依然存在。【原文：China’s economy is showing positive signs and confidence is building, but challenges such as insufficient domestic demand and deflationary pressure persist, according to the country’s central bank.】

item.title: 加密货币在区块链上重建股市的大胆尝试
item.description: 首先，他们是冲着货币市场来的。然后是货币市场。现在，加密货币的大破坏者正瞄准全球资本主义价值数万亿美元的核心：股票市场。【原文：First, they came for the currency market. Then, the money market. Now, crypto’s big disruptors are targeting the multi-trillion-dollar heart of global capitalism: the stock market.】

item.title: 美国推动在刚果-卢旺达和平协议中加入经济协定
item.description: 直接了解会谈情况的人士说，由美国斡旋达成的刚果民主共和国与卢旺达之间的和平协议将包括两国之间单独的经济一体化协定的纲要；该协定将在三个月内达成。【原文：A US-brokered peace deal between Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda will include the outlines of a separate economic integration pact between the two nations — to be concluded within three months, people with direct knowledge of the talks said.】

item.title: 普华永道的人工智能主管称，由于技术节省了员工时间，公司已经降低了价格
item.description: 全球最大的专业咨询公司之一普华永道会计师事务所（PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP）下调了部分服务的价格，原因是客户提出该咨询公司正在使用人工智能来更快地完成工作。【原文：PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, one of the world’s largest professional advisory firms, has cut prices for some services as clients raised the fact that the consultancy is using artificial intelligence to complete its work quicker.】

item.title: 土耳其计划不提高最低工资标准以吸引投资者
item.description: 据知情人士透露，土耳其政府计划不在年中上调最低工资，以抵制政治压力，缓解不断上涨的生活成本。【原文：Turkey’s government plans to skip a mid-year increase in the minimum wage, according to people with knowledge of the matter, resisting political pressure to alleviate rising living costs.】

item.title: 投入巨资后，中国电网已做好迎接高温的准备
item.description:
这是该国能源转型的关键之夏，但其电力基础设施看起来能够胜任这项任务。【原文：

It’s a crucial summer for the country’s energy transition, but its power infrastructure looks up to the task.

】

item.title: 非洲最大的独立电池投入商业运营
item.description: 电力生产商 Globeleq 表示，其耗资 3 亿美元的南非红沙项目已进入商业运营阶段，该项目将成为非洲大陆最大的独立电池储能系统。【原文：Power producer Globeleq said its $300-million Red Sands project in South Africa, that will be the biggest standalone battery energy storage system on the continent, has reached commercial close.】

item.title: 中国投资者准备好资金猎取下一个 DeepSeek
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日通讯。今天，Annabelle Droulers 将讲述她对专注于中国市场的风险投资经理的采访，以及他们在今年下半年的展望。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Annabelle Droulers recounts her interviews with China-focused VC managers and what they’re looking for in the latter half of this year.】

item.title: 曾在巴西 "灼伤 "投资者的高风险信贷产品再次 "灼伤 "投资者
item.description: 在经历了以农场破产和违约为标志的损失惨重的一年之后，一种允许个人参股巴西庞大农业综合企业的高风险投资产品再次成为关注的焦点。【原文：A risky investment product that lets individuals take a stake in Brazil’s vast agribusiness industry is back in the spotlight after a brutal year of losses marked by farm bankruptcies and defaults.】

item.title: 寿险公司提高私募债务投资以争取收益率
item.description: 全球寿险公司正面临着竞争压力，即使债务风险有上升迹象，它们也要继续增加对私人信贷的配置，以获得更高的利润。【原文：Global life insurance companies are facing competitive pressure to keep boosting their allocations to private credit to generate higher profit, even as risk in the debt shows signs of rising.】

item.title: B.Riley 将财务顾问出售给私募股权公司 TorQuest
item.description: B.Riley Financial Inc. 已将其金融咨询服务业务 GlassRatner 出售给加拿大私募股权公司 TorQuest Partners，这是该金融服务公司在应对困境的过程中又一次出售资产。【原文：B. Riley Financial Inc. has sold its financial advisory services business GlassRatner to Canadian private equity firm TorQuest Partners, adding to a series of asset sales as the financial services firm deals with its woes.】

item.title: 西班牙经济部长库尔波竞选欧元集团主席
item.description: 西班牙经济部长卡洛斯-奎尔波（Carlos Cuerpo）正在竞选欧元区财长欧元集团领导人。【原文：Spanish Economy Minister Carlos Cuerpo is running to lead the Eurogroup of euro-zone finance ministers.】

item.description:

item.title: 投资者在美联储推动的反弹中稍事休息，国债下跌
item.description: 美国国债下跌，缩减了本周的涨幅，因为投资者在为当天晚些时候将公布的通胀数据做准备，预计该数据将显示消费者价格增长加速。【原文：US Treasuries fell, trimming their weekly advance, as investors prepared for inflation data due later on the day that is expected to show an acceleration in consumer price growth.】

item.title: Centrica 正就 Sizewell C 核电项目 15% 的股份进行深入谈判
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，Centrica Plc 正在就收购英国 Sizewell C 核电项目 15%的股份进行深入讨论。【原文：Centrica Plc is in advanced discussions to acquire a 15% stake in the UK’s Sizewell C nuclear power project, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英伟达突围，4 万亿美元市值触手可及
item.description: 在 Nvidia 公司成为首家市值达到 1 万亿美元的芯片制造商从而创造历史两年后，一个更令人瞩目的里程碑即将到来：成为首家市值达到 4 万亿美元的公司。【原文：Two years after Nvidia Corp. made history by becoming the first chipmaker to achieve a $1 trillion market capitalization, an even more remarkable milestone is within its grasp: becoming the first company to reach $4 trillion.】

item.title: 贝莱德与穆巴达拉解除亚洲私人信贷合作关系
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc. and Mubadala Investment Co. have mutually agreed to unwind their Asian private credit partnership that focuses on investments in China and Indonesia due to challenges in sourcing deals, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美银美林的哈特内特认为美联储转向和减税带来股票泡沫风险
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的迈克尔-哈特内特（Michael Hartnett）认为，随着美国降息预期吸引大量投资流入股市，股市投机泡沫的风险正在增加。【原文：The risk of a speculative stock-market bubble is increasing as expectations of US interest-rate cuts draw massive investment flows into equities, according to Bank of America Corp.’s Michael Hartnett.】

item.title: 利润引擎出现衰退，S&P 500 指数反弹面临关键考验
item.description: S&P 500 指数即将创下历史新高，但距离财报季只有几周时间，反弹的基础即将面临重大考验。【原文：The S&P 500 Index is on the cusp of a record high but with earnings season just weeks away, the foundation of the rally is about to get a major test.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数历史性季度反弹，推动指数逼近历史纪录
item.description: 在短短三个月内，从险些跌入熊市到距离历史最高点只差几个点。这一反弹具有历史意义。【原文：From narrowly avoiding a bear market to a few points shy of a record high in just three months. This rebound is historic.】

item.title: 贝莱德的 Brazier 因庞大的支出计划而对德国债券持谨慎态度
item.description: Blackrock Inc. 投资与投资组合解决方案全球主管 Alex Brazier 表示，尽管欧洲投资者可能会从美国带回现金，但由于德国雄心勃勃的财政扩张，德国政府债券看起来缺乏吸引力。【原文：German government bonds look unattractive due to the country’s ambitious fiscal expansion, despite potential appetite from European investors bringing cash home from the US, said Alex Brazier, Blackrock Inc.’s global head of investments and portfolio solutions.】

item.title: 印度 JSW 计划出售 4.68 亿美元债务以资助阿克苏交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度企业集团 JSW 集团正在与全球贷款机构洽谈，以筹集约 400 亿卢比（4.68 亿美元）的资金，为收购 Akzo Nobel NV 的本地业务提供部分资金。【原文：Indian conglomerate JSW Group is in talks with global lenders to raise about 40 billion rupees ($468 million) to partly fund its purchase of Akzo Nobel NV’s local business, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 长期抗击通胀后，智利央行决策者看到了好兆头
item.description: 智利央行董事会成员路易斯-费利佩-塞斯佩德斯（Luis Felipe Cespedes）在接受采访时表示，智利央行认为一系列因素的共同作用将有助于使通胀率在2026年初回到目标值。【原文：Chile’s central bank sees a set of factors coming together that will help bring inflation back down to target early in 2026, board member Luis Felipe Cespedes said in an interview.】

item.title: 南非股市有望延续上半年黄金涨势
item.description: 南非股市将迎来近二十年来表现最好的上半年，贵金属价格可能会为进一步上涨铺平道路。【原文：South African stocks are heading for their best first-half performance in almost two decades, and precious-metal prices could pave the way for further gains.】
